intro: Inga densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered inga, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its rapid growth and nitrogen-fixing ability make it an important species in ecological restoration projects.
